Author: Cicely Tyson, Robin Miles
Book Review: Narrator Robin Miles bringing the same warmth and depth of characterization to Cicely Tyson’s memoir as she did to Isabel Wilkerson’s Caste.

Author: Andrea Lee
Book Review: The stories of Andrea Lee’s Red Island House are vibrant and enchanting despite the current of dread that runs through the novel from the start.

Author: Matthew Gavin Frank
Book Review: Matthew Gavin Frank's Flight of the Diamond Smugglers is a fascinating exploration of the history of mining in South Africa, born of personal tragedy.

Author: Linda Sue Park, Robert Sa
Book Review: In The One Thing You’d Save, a teacher named Ms. Chang invites her students to participate in a thought exercise. If their house caught fire, what one thing would they choose to save? Each child, along with Ms. Chang, considers, chooses and then explains their selection.

Author: Gayle Tzemach Lemmon
Book Review: The story of how young Kurdish women brought down terrorists from the Islamic State group finally gets told in The Daughters of Kobani.

Author: Arik Kershenbaum
Book Review: Zoologist Arik Kershenbaum draws on a range of scientific disciplines to contemplate what characteristics extraterrestrial animals might possess.

Author: Tommy Greenwald
Book Review: In Rivals, Tommy Greenwald’s second novel set in the fictional town of Walthorne (after 2018’s Game Changer), having fun is immaterial when it comes to a high-pressure middle school basketball season between the Walthorne North Cougars and the Walthorne South Panthers. Everyone wants...

Author: Jamie Figueroa
Book Review: Ghosts hover over Jamie Figueroa’s debut, a lyrical contemplation of how we can never run away from our past.

Author: Pamela Terry
Book Review: Pamela Terry’s debut novel sometimes feels like a mashup of Fried Green Tomatoes and You Can’t Go Home Again with a sprinkling of William Faulkner.

Author: Chris Whitaker
Book Review: Chris Whitaker combines a brisk pace, a solid California voice and perhaps a record-setting cuss count.
